results.title: Men of Medicine
results.brief_description: Follows a young physician through some of the problems facing the young doctor today - successfully meeting the medical needs of his community, and winning the confidence and respect of the people. Discusses how the benefits of modern medicine can be made available to all.
results.description: Follows a young physician through some of the problems facing the young doctor today - successfully meeting the medical needs of his community, and winning the confidence and respect of the people. Discusses how the benefits of modern medicine can be made available to all.

results.title: Men of Capricorn
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Barbie Smith
results.brief_description: The variety of the country and the people of the Capricorn region of Queensland. Cattle and sheep grazing in the country surrounding Longreach, which is the market centre and shore worn; oil waiting to be struck; the Moura open-cut coal mines; and nearer the coast the Callide open cut; Mount Morgan copper, gold and silver mines; on the coast Rockhampton is the terminal for coals, minerals, wool and beef, and the beginning of the railway into the heart of Queensland.

results.title: Men of Canungra
results.brief_description: Shows methods of training at the Jungle Training Centre at Canungra to achieve proficiency in jungle warfare. Tactics are shown being discussed. Combat survival training, physical toughening up, jungle craft and techniques lead up to the successful ambush and defeat of enemy troops by a jungle patrol.

results.title: Men like me
results.brief_description: “Men like me” is a collaboration between the filmmaker and Dale Michaels and was made in 1994 when female to male transgender was relatively unfamiliar to the broader community and rarely discussed. Informative and sensitively presented the film uses interviews, vox pops, archival footage and stills, combined with computer animated images and narration by Susan Long and Dale Michaels.

results.title: Men like me
results.creator_credit: Sylvie Shaw, Wild Cat Productions, Film Victoria and Susan Long
results.brief_description: ‘Men Like Me’ is the story of Dale Michaels, who changed his sexual identity from female to male. It is also an account of the filmmaker’s response to a friend’s need to change their identity and what that entailed. The film is a collaboration between the filmmaker and Dale Michaels and was made in 1994 when female to male transgender was relatively unfamiliar to the broader community and rarely discussed. Informative and sensitively presented using interviews, vox pops, archival footage and stills, combined with computer animated images and narration by Susan Long and Dale Michaels.

results.title: Men in crisis
results.brief_description: Discusses how after a decade of Russian domination, the people of Hungary launch a desperate battle from freedom in 1956, how their appeal to the free world is rejected and their Prime Minster Nagy is imprisoned.
results.description: Discusses how after a decade of Russian domination, the people of Hungary launch a desperate battle from freedom in 1956, how their appeal to the free world is rejected and their Prime Minster Nagy is imprisoned.

results.title: Men in black (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Amblin Entertainment, MacDonald Parkes Productions, Walter Parkes, Laurie MacDonald and Barry Sonenfield
results.brief_description: The talents behind this special effects bonanza are onto something special - lovely laser-keen wit that comes at warp speed, with modesty and effortless cool. With a new alien critter roughly every 10 minutes - only the sheer presence of the main actors Tommy Lee Jones and Wil Smith keeps them from being upstaged. They are the best kept secret in the universe, their mission is to monitor extra-terrestrial activity on earth. They are our best, last and only line of defence. They work in secret, they exist in shadow - they are the Men in Black! Based on the comic by Lowell Cunningham.

results.title: Men for others
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Vincent Tovell
results.brief_description: Discusses the tole of the church in our modern society, and its attempts to find a new way in a secular world. The letters of Nazi martyr, Dietrich Bonhoeffer, form a basis for a new look church. Scientific development, increasing man’s power of construction and destruction has also increased his moral responsibility. Social injustices suffered by the coloured races are presented as the greatest challenge to the church and man today.

results.title: Men encounter Mars
results.creator_credit: Drew Associates, Gregory Shuker and James Lipscomb
results.brief_description: A behind the scenes documentary about the many engineers and scientists who planned and carried out the complex job of photographing the surface of Mars.
